title: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
OB: When opening an editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository, if the end of the first line is selected and a space character is added, the file becomes marked as dirty.
EB: When performing the following steps: 1) Click on the close box in the editor tab. 2) Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog. 3) Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it, the process should take about 8 seconds. However, if the same steps are followed and the 'Revert' option is selected from the pop-up menu in the editor, the process takes about 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
SR:
1) Open the editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets'.
2) Select the end of the first line and add a space character.
3) Observe that the file becomes marked as dirty.
4) Click on the close box in the editor tab.
5) When prompted with the 'do you want to save changes' dialog, select 'no'.
6) Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
7) Observe that the process takes about 8 seconds to complete.
8) Repeat steps 1) and 2).
9) From the pop-up menu in the editor, select 'Revert'.
10) Observe that the process takes about 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
